user.name: American Red Cross of Central Florida & USVI
American Red Cross of Central Florida & USVI

text: Homeowners & Renters: if you suffered damages from both #Helene & #Milton & are eligible for disaster assistance, you need to submit 2 different applications - one for each storm.  Apply via: disasterassistance.gov, call 800-621-3362, FEMA App, or visit a local DRC.  More info⤵️

#Helene and #Milton survivors: if you suffered flooding damages & have insurance, jump-start your recovery by contacting your agent ASAP to start the claim process.  Call or visit floodsmart.gov/flood-insuran… if you need help locating your insurance carrier.

#Helene #ByTheNumbers: One Month Later ⤵️  - Over $1.4B for recovery in affected communities - Nearly 5,000 personnel helping on the ground  Our federal family is working to meet the needs of survivors & affected communities. We will be there for as long as it takes to recover.

Hillsborough County and the Florida Department of Emergency Management (FDEM) will close the Multi-Agency Resource Center (MARC) in Town ‘N Country for individuals impacted by Hurricanes Milton, Helene, and Debby at 5:30 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 27.   Details: https://bit.ly/48pup2x

"We're working on putting the river back where it was so we can have a place to rebuild the road."  Old Toe River Road in Avery County is a complete rebuild after #HeleneNC, but a vital one to getting WNC back to full strength.

Jeffry Fritsma, #USACE Detroit District and Bobbi Trout, Omaha District, discuss collection of information for the Operation Blue Roof mission. Temporary roofs protect property and allow residents to remain in their homes while recovering from Hurricane #Milton. 1/2
REMINDER: Our two vegetative debris drop-off sites are open daily from 7am-7pm. Free for Tampa residents.  🌿 22nd Street Park 🌿 Gadsden Park  Remember - no plastic bags!
‘We are going to continue to remain here,’ FEMA chief says in Augusta https://www.wrdw.com/2024/10/23/we-are-going-continue-remain-here-fema-chief-says-augusta/

We're honored to welcome Trevor Riggen, American Red Cross Pres. of Humanitarian Services, to our shelter for those affected by #Milton.    As we continue to assist with recovery efforts, support from our leadership team reinforces our commitment to alleviate human suffering.

#Florida: We opened a mobile DRC in Franklin County to help survivors affected by #Milton & #Helene. Visit the Eastpoint County Building Dept. until 10/27, 8 a.m.-4:30 p.m.  Apply online at DisasterAssistance.gov or use the FEMA app. More centers: fema.gov/drc

Helene #ByTheNumbers in Georgia: One Month Later ⤵️ - $171M for recovery in affected communities. - 231 personnel helping on the ground.  Our federal family is working to meet the needs of survivors & affected communities. We will be there for as long as it takes to recover.

#Helene and #Milton survivors, if you applied for disaster assistance and have questions about the next step, we're here to help! Get answers to your questions: fema.gov/assistance/individu…   What you can expect during the application process. ⤵️

Affected by the hurricane & making home repairs? 🏠 Join our Hurricane Recovery + Rebuilding Virtual Townhall to learn about permitting, tax assessment implications, grant programs, & more.  📆 Nov 1 at 11am 🔗 tampa.gov/register to sign up & submit your questions

We can still see the destruction left behind by the tornadoes and storms triggered by Hurricane #Milton throughout Florida.  💔   With your help, we can continue to provide aid in the recovery process. Consider signing up to become a volunteer by visiting redcross.org.

We're stronger together! 💪  Volunteers came together to help plan the path to rebuild after Hurricanes Helene and Milton. Local organizations helped to identify areas of need and shared how they can assist. Find storm resources at HCFL.gov/StormRecovery.

If you applied for Hurricane #Helene or #Milton disaster assistance, make sure to keep your application up-to-date. As you submit more info, you may be eligible for more FEMA programs.  Update your application ⤵️ 🔹 Online: Disasterassistance.gov 🔹 Call: 1-800-621-3362 🔹 Use the FEMA App

If you had damage from #Helene, you do not need to wait for a @fema home inspection or insurance adjuster before beginning to clean up.   After you apply for disaster assistance, a FEMA inspector will contact you to schedule an appointment. More information: https://www.fema.gov/fact-sheet/dont-wait-clean-or-make-repairs-0

#GEORGIA! Interested in applying for a federal job? @FEMA is hosting a job fair in Augusta, GA!  - Wed 10/30, 9:30 -4:00 p.m. - May Park Community Center 622 4th Street Augusta, Georgia 30901  Learn how to navigate @USAJobs and build an effective resume  https://www.fema.gov/event/fema-job-fair-augusta-georgia

If you have questions about your application status or need in-person support, visit a Disaster Recovery Center (DRC).  We have DRCs across all affected states, find one near you at fema.gov/drc or text DRC and your ZIP CODE to 43362.  #Helene #Milton

If you have questions related to #Helene recovery, please visit a Multi-Agency Resource Center or Disaster Recovery Center, depending on where you live.   Centers are open 7 a.m. - 7 p.m. on Saturdays and 12 p.m. - 5 p.m. on Sundays.
